abstracts.cdata!:
The Surabaya Urban Development Project
            is for urban infrastructure development and environmental
            improvement in Surabaya and includes all expenditure in
            Surabaya for the next 6 years on urban roads and transport,
            urban drainage, water supply, solid waste management,
            sanitation and kampung improvement.  It also includes
            improvements in urban management by institutional and human
            resources development, in financial management, in community
            participation and in land management, as well as technical
            assistance and training.  This report is an environmental
            assessment of the project.  It reviews the environmental
            impacts that each of the project component will have on the
            environment.  These impacts are: 1) resettlement of affected
            people; 2) traffic disruption; 3) encouragement of
            accelerated wetland development due to influence of nearby
            ring road; 4) changes to Brackish water ponds in East
            Surabaya; 5) change to agriculture due to conversion of
            irrigation channels to drainage; 6) expansion of landfill at
            Keputih; 7) continued operation of Kenjeran Beach Landfill;
            8) air pollution and health risks to residents near new
            depots or transfer stations; and 9) air and noise pollution
            due to digging sewer pipe trenches. The report also presents
            a description of the project, the baseline data, an analysis
            of the alternatives, the mitigation plans, monitoring and
            evaluation, institutional needs and, finally, public participation.
